image.altText: Drone image of Elcho Island.

props.synopsis: Health workers say new data showing hepatitis B cases have almost tripled in the NT reflects better access to care, with the territory also leading the nation in reducing mortality rates.

title.children: Hepatitis B cases are rising in the NT, but experts say it's a positive sign

image.altText: A picture of white off the ground apartments

props.synopsis: The NT Supreme Court is set to hand down a ruling on whether a major community housing provider is exempt from paying council rates in Palmerston. It's a case which may set a territory-wide precedent, reshape council budgets and force them to slash services or hike rates.

title.children: This NT Supreme Court case may trigger a rates rise for territory home owners

image.altText: Headshot of woman in jacket from side

props.synopsis: NT Opposition Leader Selena Uibo held a press conference on Friday to disclose the misuse, just days after travel logs were released to the ABC through Freedom of Information.

title.children: NT Labor leader misuses taxpayer-funded chauffeur service for private trips

image.altText: A close up shot of white woman, blonde shoulder length hair, light brown framed glasses, wearing a khaki green blazer.

props.synopsis: The NT's attorney-general says she is focused on protecting victims regardless of their cultural background and questions allegations that the government's suite of crime reforms is targeting Aboriginal Territorians.

title.children: NT politician says 'it's not racist to want a safer community'

image.altText: A close up shot of a white man in a blue polo that reads 'TPS Security' with a bag strap across his back. Black semi-curly hair

props.synopsis: There's been a spike in reports of violent and anti-social incidents in the CBD, as Darwin businesses call for more government investment in late-night security patrols.

title.children: Darwin workers, tourists spat at and abused after security patrol hours cut

image.altText: Reece Walsh fends off Cameron Munster in the NRL grand final.

props.synopsis: Brisbane captain Adam Reynolds pulls up with a leg injury in the second half of the NRL grand final as Broncos hold a narrow lead over the Storm in the dying minutes. Follow live.

title.children: NRL grand final down to the wire as Broncos lead Storm despite losing halves

image.altText: A man in a hood poses in front of a computer with the anonymous logo on it.

props.synopsis: Cybersecurity analysts warn that three of the most notorious English-speaking cybercrime groups are still operating as the "super group" known as Trinity of Chaos, despite recently announcing retirement.

title.children: Inside the 'Trinity of Chaos': How young hackers are uniting to hit big companies

image.altText: illustration of a judge in a red cape and wig with face a screen of mathematical symbols

props.synopsis: Artificial intelligence is coming for the law. Are we ready for robots to become judge and jury?

title.children: Lawyers are using AI. What will happen when judges do?

image.altText: A man in a suit smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: An afternoon tea meeting with a president is not the sort of invitation you get every day as a foreign correspondent, but when I met Finland's Alexander Stubb in Helsinki, it taught me a lot about another world leader.

title.children: I got an unexpected afternoon tea invite, and it told me a lot about Trump

image.altText: A woman with short black hair speaks into a microphone.

props.synopsis: Sanae Takaichi has won Japan's Liberal Democratic Party's leadership contest and is likely to become the country's first female PM. Here's what we know about her.

title.children: Once a rock drummer, Sanae Takaichi is set to become Japan's first female PM

image.altText: Bread, jam, biscuits, dip, muesli bars and sausages on a white background.

props.synopsis: The main ingredient in dozens of supermarket products has been reduced, an ABC investigation has found, leading retail and marketing experts to call for more transparency around recipe changes.

title.children: Why you might be paying more for reduced quality at the supermarket

image.altText: Lady standing side on to camera with earrings that say "Stop violence against woman".

props.synopsis: Larissa Waters says she will be looking closely at the Robbins Island wind farm, which the Greens's two Tasmanian senators say will threaten several endangered species.

title.children: Greens leader 'doesn't know very much' about wind farm opposed by colleagues

image.altText: Man and woman together at a dinner table

props.synopsis: Nathalie Matthews, 38, was arrested after arriving into Sydney on a flight from Dubai this morning.

title.children: Mark Latham's ex-partner charged with sharing intimate images

image.altText: Ray Martin speaks to the room.

props.synopsis: After six decades as a journalist, Ray Martin says he has learnt the secret to a long and satisfying career.

title.children: After 60 years, one piece of advice keeps this 80-year-old journalist from retiring

image.altText: A wide shot of mass destruction, rubble and a large grey smoke plume over a horizon.

props.synopsis: For the first time since the conflict in Gaza began nearly two years ago, an American president told Israel to stop — and it did.

title.children: Trump's Gaza ceasefire plan could become the best hope to end bloodshed

image.altText: A group of rifles laid out in a row on the floor.

props.synopsis: More than 100 firearms are seized in a WA Police operation targeting 'sovereign citizens' in the wake of the fatal shooting of two Victorian officers.

title.children: ‘A risk we cannot take’: Police seize 135 guns amid sovereign citizen raids

image.altText: A man in a suit kisses a woman in a wedding dress

props.synopsis: The event was part of a government campaign aiming to make civil weddings more accessible across the country.

title.children: Mass wedding ceremony in Paraguay sees thousands say 'I do' in unison

image.altText: A sign prohibiting drones at Munich Airport.

props.synopsis: In total, around 30 flights and nearly 6,000 passengers were impacted by the closures.

title.children: Lithuania's Vilnius Airport reopens after balloon sightings in airspace

image.altText: Two large space antennas surrounded by trees and red dirt in New Norcia.

props.synopsis: A second deep space antenna opened in a tiny monastic town in Western Australia could help unlock the secrets of the universe.

title.children: The new antenna that could theoretically receive a phone call from Mars

image.altText: Close up of a blood red moon.

props.synopsis: Can a full moon affect your periods? A new study suggests there's a link, but others say there's little evidence. We look at the facts and debunk some myths.

title.children: Menstrual myths debunked: What does your cycle sync with?

image.altText: Sean Diddy Combs looking at something with sunglasses on

props.synopsis: Sean "Diddy" Combs may have just been sentenced to four years in prison, but he still faces a mountain of lawsuits accusing him of sexual violence and other misconduct.

title.children: Here's what's next for Diddy now he's been sentenced to four years in prison

image.altText: a boat in a port with shipping containers around it

props.synopsis: A $20 million loan from the Tasmanian government to keep smelter Liberty Bell Bay afloat after it flagged financial woes earlier this year has led to the first shipment of ore being delivered.

title.children: Premier calls on Tasmanian smelter to 'crack on with it' after ore woes

image.altText: Aluminum containers containing rice, tofu, fried fish, vegetables, and melon slices.

props.synopsis: The key election commitment of President Prabowo Subianto is facing mounting backlash over its poor oversight, questionable food sourcing and unhygienic kitchens.

title.children: Indonesia's free meal program poisons thousands of children

image.altText: nsw police forensic officers at suspicious death in Melonba 051025

props.synopsis: The Homicide Squad is investigating the circumstances surrounding the death of an 84-year-old woman, who was found in her bedroom about midday Saturday.

title.children: Police strike force established after 'suspicious' death in Western Sydney

image.altText: Sailors and women on the Rotor at Sydney's Luna Park in the 1940s.

props.synopsis: Now in its 90th year, Sydney's Luna Park was not always so family-friendly.

title.children: Segregation, sex work and Sydney: Luna Park's forgotten history

image.altText: A woman with a dog standing next to a placard saying a home is for sale.

props.synopsis: Councillors say they recognise that small housing is needed to meet housing demand, but state government support will be needed to build key infrastructure.

title.children: Single-person households, couples with fewer kids want smaller homes

image.altText: An illustration showing figures of people in a parliament setting with blue and red symbols above their heads.

props.synopsis: In Australian politics, words and phrases used in parliament that are seen as insulting, abusive, or a deliberate lie are determined to be "unparliamentary language".

title.children: Politicians are banned from using these words and phrases in parliament

image.altText: Tom in a blue suit behind a podium with a shocked face. Hard Quiz Kids logo in the top right corner

props.synopsis: I find it interesting you think you could beat the know-it-all tweens on Hard Quiz Kids. How about you prove it? Let's play, HARD!

title.children: Are these pipsqueaks smarter than you? Let's play, HARD!

image.altText: Police officers in black uniforms, some with yellow jackets, stand among police vehicles.

props.synopsis: UK police are continuing to question four people arrested on suspicion of terror offences after an attack on a Manchester synagogue on Thursday that left two people dead.

title.children: UK police holding four people arrested over Manchester synagogue attack

image.altText: A man helps a woman down from the window of a badly-damaged building, with smoke rising around

props.synopsis: Ali Jadallah's photo, called Leaving Home, shows three people emerging from the rubble of their damaged building.

title.children: See all the winners from the Siena Awards Photo Festival

image.altText: Monique Conti kicks the ball for the Tigers in a 2025 AFLW match.

props.synopsis: Richmond's dismal losing streak is over, with midfielder Monique Conti playing a starring role in a shock win over competition heavyweights Adelaide.

title.children: Conti inspires Tigers to end AFLW drought, Blues see off Cats challenge

image.altText: gas flares from pipes in the air

props.synopsis: The Browse gas project is staring down the full weight of Australia's climate movement. Analysts say that is the least of its worries.

title.children: Financial analysts cast doubt on mega Woodside gas project

image.altText: Andrew Hastie speaks in a corridor in Parliament House

props.synopsis: Hastie says he decided to quit because a letter she sent him earlier in the week made clear he wouldn't be formulating the Coalition's immigration policies.

title.children: Andrew Hastie's resignation could not be worse timing for Sussan Ley

image.altText: The bronze statue sits in the red sand with a metal detector in the background

props.synopsis: A Ming Dynasty Buddha statue found on a roadside in Western Australia's Shark Bay region seven years ago could soon be repatriated to the largest Buddhist population in the world.

title.children: Accidental treasure hunters want to send ancient Buddha statue 'home'
